Key Match Events: Dennis Man scored a brilliant solo effort in the 40th minute to break the deadlock.
Răzvan Marin calmly converted from the penalty spot in the 51st minute to extend Romania’s lead to 2-0.
Denis Drăguș pounced to score from close range in the 82nd minute, sealing Romania’s dominant 3-0 win.
Pre-Game Insights: This match marked the debut of Mircea Lucescu as Romania’s national team coach after a 38-year hiatus.
Post-Match Reflections: This victory provides a strong start for Romania in the Nations League and offers a promising beginning for Mircea Lucescu’s new tenure as head coach.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Romania dominated the first half of the Kosovo-Romania encounter, creating several chances early on.
Romania continued their control after the break, and their possession percentage was 43%.
The match was played at Stadiumi Fadil Vokrri (Pristina) with an attendance of 12,872.
Others: Expected Goals (xG) for Kosovo was 0.37, while for Romania it was 3.06.
Kosovo made triple substitution in the 66th minute.
